metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20446 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
In xml.rs in GNOME librsvg before 2.46.2, a crafted SVG file with nested patterns can cause denial of service when passed to the library for processing. The attacker constructs pattern elements so that the number of final rendered objects grows exponentially.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-20446` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-rsvg-2.0 - 2.46.4-1ubuntu1
librsvg2-2 - 2.46.4-1ubuntu1
librsvg2-bin - 2.46.4-1ubuntu1
librsvg2-common - 2.46.4-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> also affects older versions written in C The fixes added to 2.40.21 cause a regression, and upstream will not be fixing them.

criterions.comment: librsvg package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.46.4-1ubuntu1').
